alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT...EAST CENTRAL DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 358 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Tolar, or 22 miles east of Fort Sumner, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, Taiban and Tolar. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 328 and 356. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
